name: (2Z)-2-(1,3-Benzodioxol-5-ylmethylene)-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,3]thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidin-3(2H)-one
Reason: 1,3-Benzodioxole base, with a melting point around 106°C, due to the presence of two carbonyl groups, which can participate in dipole interactions and rigidify the structure, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C each. The methylene bridge introduces additional rigidity, contributing approximately +5°C. The thiazole ring introduces additional rigidity, contributing approximately +20°C. The pyrimidine ring introduces additional rigidity, contributing approximately +30°C. The presence of two carbonyl groups can also form strong hydrogen bonds, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C each.
